meanings.definition: The act of attributing something to a different source or cause.
meanings.sent1: Her reattributions of the artwork to the correct artist were praised by the art community.
meanings.sent2: The reattributions of the success to her hard work were well-deserved.
meanings.sent3: After the reattributions of the mistake to the cat, everyone had a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: The reattributions of the crime to the wrong suspect led to a breakthrough in the case.
meanings.sent5: The reattributions of the smell to the nearby bakery made her stomach growl.

meanings.definition: The process of assigning or crediting something to a different person or entity.
meanings.sent1: The reattributions of the award to the correct winner brought tears of joy.
meanings.sent2: His reattributions of the idea to his colleague showed great teamwork.
meanings.sent3: The reattributions of the lost keys to the dog were unexpected but amusing.
meanings.sent4: The reattributions of the success to luck rather than skill were disappointing.
meanings.sent5: The reattributions of the noise to the wind made the night seem eerie.
